page.title: 14 Playground Games (2)
page.content: Skipping games for groups of children are very popular. A long rope is turned by children whilst others in groups or in turn, jump in and skip. In "French Skipping" a long piece of elastic is used instead of a rope. Two children stand opposite each other with the elastic around their ankles, and another jumps in and out, or in and on the elastic. In both kinds of skipping, rhymes like these are chanted :-"Down in the valley when the goats go push! ", "I like coffee, I like tea, I like ---- in with me. I hate coffee, I hate tea, I hate ---- in with me." and " I'm a little bumper car, number 48. I whizz round the corner and slam on the brakes. How many gallons did he lose? 5, 10, 15, etc."
